title: [BUG] changelog generator misses substantial fraction of PR

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

body:
Update:
not only do the PR retrieved fluctuate in/out, it seems that the changelog generator missed a substantial fraction of changes - around 40 PR and 7 contributors between 0.13.0 and 0.13.1.

The missed changes are in the diff of this PR: https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/3241

---

There's still something not quite right with the changelog generator.

I've rerun the script after having merged some PR, and it removes merged PR as well as contributors that were previously in the changelog.

This is very odd, there does not seem to be a commonality between the entries.

Running the changelog generator against the current content of the 0.13.1 release branch changelog removes the following:

```
* [ENH] dedicated ``_update`` for ``BATS`` and ``TBATS`` (:pr:`3086`) :user:`jelc53`
* [DOC] code quality docs expanded with instructions for local code quality checking set-up (:pr:`3089`) :user:`fkiraly`
* [MNT] remove custom ``__repr__`` from ``BaseTask``, inherit from ``BaseObject`` (:pr:`3049`) :user:`fkiraly`
* [DOC] Added NumFOCUS to sponsors website (:pr:`3093`) :user:`aiwalter`
```

and the entire "refactored" section.

FYI @lmmentel.
